body: @fpj  I  removed some unnecessary code and i used makeSurePersistentPathExists(path) method call to  make sure zknode exists.
LGTM. cc @ijuma just FYI.
This probably needs a KIP. Can you create a new KIP for it?
@granders One of the sanity checks failed, is it unrelated?

@ewencp Yes and no - as I think you may have pointed out elsewhere, the success of the verifiable producer sanity check is actually somewhat timing dependent - it relies on the `ps` command running while the producer process is still alive, and therefore before all of the messages have been produced.

The error message said the `ps` command said "this is not the process you are looking for", so my suspicion is that reducing the message size made the producer process finish more quickly. That's why I increased the number of messages (~1 second worth) to give more headroom. This passes consistently locally
@ijuma Thanks for the reviews. Will update the patch.

@granders This looks good. Two thoughts. First, ConsoleConsumer looks like the one BackgroundThreadService that has potentially fixed work to do that didn't get this treatment. It's stop_node is pretty straightforward already, is that why we didn't make it consistent? Second, the fact that the same pattern repeats across all these classes suggests we might want to provide this functionality in a base class at some point. Doesn't have to happen now, but adding a class in either ducktape or kafkatest probably makes sense (and would get rid of quite a bit of common boilerplate I think, basically just leaving things like the actual command line construction and process name to kill to the subclasses).
LGTM
@ijuma I have updated the RB. Let me know if there are any changes required. I will be on it.
Cc @hachikuji
LGTM too. Thanks!
@junrao @srdo for reviews.
LGTM

If anyone has a good reason for the choice between excluding the entry from the map or including the topic entry with a zero value, I'm open to suggestions.
@onurkaraman LGTM. Glad to have you back in the game!
Merged to trunk and 0.10.0.
@ijuma Your suggestion makes sense to me. I can't think of a case where an assignor would need to distinguish between the two cases.

To be clear, Jason is agreeing with the first option, which is to only include in the map topics that have 1 partition or more (a topic with 0 partitions is an edge-case, but it could potentially happen). While at it, could you fix the `return tag` in the javadoc for the abstract `AbstractPartitionAssignor.assign`? The sentence is incomplete.
@ijuma I just force pushed an update with the defensive check and `return tag` fix for `AbstractPartitionAssignor.assign`.
LGTM

LGTM overall, Jenkins failure are not related (filed separate JIRA).

About the DefaultClientSupplier: in general I'd prefer to keep things private until we see common requirement for them to be public, since vice versa cannot be easily done due to backward incompatibility. Thoughts?

looks like jenkins is being flaky.

The most recent build failed to create a gc thread: https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/3740/

My previous jenkins build without the defensive check and javadoc update succeeded: https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/3737/
Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Just a minor comment.

I've made the requested changes to move mutable attributes to constructor, use IOException not LZ4Exception, drop explicit 'this' references, and update upgrade docs.

I have not updated client code because I dont have a good vision for what that would look like. I mentioned in the KIP discuss email thread that the client plumbing around compression handling is a bit too much for me to grok. I am happy to take some pointers from others who understand java code better than I do. But also I am ok with enforcing strict semantics in the broker and letting clients be more forgiving since they (clients) have access to other bit-flip protection, like Message-level CRC.
LGTM
I ran the tests locally before merging.
@ijuma Thanks a lot for all the reviews.
@MayureshGharat Thanks for addressing all comments (and for the PR). :)
Thank you very much for the update @dpkp. I'll try to help with the client plumbing around compression.

@coughman Thanks for adding the clarification. Can you add "Minor: " to the pr description (i.e. "Minor: added description..."

This is how Apache Kafka names changes that are small and don't require a JIRA.

The code in this PR means that offset returned by `buildOffsetMapForSegment` can terminate at a point which is not on segment boundaries. How does that work with `clean` which seems to assume that `buildOffsetMap` terminated at a segment boundary?
Merged to trunk and 0.10.0.
ok, thanks!

@alekar We will try to fit the first segment in the map. For subsequent segments, we use offset difference as an upper bound of the number of messages and will not add the messages in the segment to the map. This ensures that we always stop at a segment boundary or throw an exception if the map cannot fit the first segment.
@Ishiihara isn't that difference in segment offsets the bad heuristic causing this issue? Also, it has no way of accounting for duplicate ratio.

@alekar Agreed. I think the fix is to make the minimum change to account for fixing the issue. Also, if we ends up not adding the segment to the map in this round, we will add the segment in the next round. 

I agree that reading the segment can make a better estimate, but it also have additional IO cost and memory overhead.  In terms of performance, it really depends on the key distribution in a segment.

@Ishiihara right. If you look at what I had in mind (on JIRA), it trades off how many segments it can compact in one run. I'm happy to take this up as an improvement if a quick fix is required at this moment.

However, I am skeptical that moving the use of offset difference out to the second segment seen by `buildOffsetMap` is a true fix.

> About the DefaultClientSupplier: in general I'd prefer to keep things private until we see common requirement for them to be public, since vice versa cannot be easily done due to backward incompatibility. Thoughts?

Okay, as all methods of DefaultKafkaClientSupplier are fairly easy to re-implement by users, let me follow your advice ATM :+1:

@alekar @edoardocomar The fix will solve the issue in the JIRA as we alway make sure that the first segment fit in the map with the its actual size.  But I aggre it does not solve the map utilization problem. As I said, this is a minimum change to address the JIRA. I will close this PR and waiting for @alekar's PR .

@junrao @alekar By adding another offset map we are effectively cutting the usable memory to half for compaction, and I'm wondering if just moving the `require`  into the `buildOffsetMapForSegment` with `offsetMap` itself is sufficient?

This PR is for kafka's trunk branch.
https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1329 I will fix Integration test failures after we decide if that `take all or no offsets from segment` approach is necessary on JIRA.
This PR is for kafka's 0.10 branch.
@dpkp, it would also be great if you could retest kafka-python against the updated PR (if you haven't already).
Thanks for the PR. We only need a PR for trunk, the merge script allows us to target other branches too. So can you please close this one (we can't do it ourselves)?

It was intentional not to add this constructor back in `0.10` as `KafkaConfig` is not public API and companion object methods are easier to understand than overloaded constructors. Having said that, we can add this back if it helps existing projects. Did you say, spark streaming is relying on this?
Ah, I didn't realize that. For sure, let me close this.

Yeah, Spark Streaming relies on this. I don't think it's a big change for Kafka to make, so I'd prefer if Kafka made this change. That way we don't have to do reflection in Spark to be able to build against Kafka 0.9 and 0.10, it save us a bunch of work:-)
LGTM, will merge once the tests pass.
Thanks @zhuchen1018, a couple of minor comments. Looks good otherwise. Will merge as soon as they are addressed.
LGTM.
LGTM
As per JIRA, the take all or none approach in this PR is not necessary.
